definition[0]: the loss of other people’s respect because you have done something they strongly disapprove of
example[0]: Smith faced total public disgrace after the incident.
example[1]: His actions brought disgrace on the family.
example[2]: There was no disgrace in finishing fourth.
example[3]: Toranaga sent us away in disgrace.
definition[1]: to do something so bad that you make other people feel ashamed
note[1]: be (publicly) disgraced (=be made to feel ashamed, especially in public)
example[4]: How could you disgrace us all like that?
example[5]: I’m not the one who disgraced herself at the wedding!
